motivations: Uncover the truth about their mysterious past
Save their hometown from an impending disaster
Find a cure for a rare disease plaguing their family
Overthrow a tyrannical ruler and restore peace
Master an ancient and powerful form of magic
Avenge the wrongful death of a loved one
Become the best in their chosen field or profession
Navigate and survive a post-apocalyptic world
Break a curse that has haunted their lineage for generations
Build a successful business from scratch
Explore uncharted territories and discover new worlds
Protect a coveted secret from falling into the wrong hands
Win a prestigious competition against all odds
Invent something that changes the course of history
Escape from a life of poverty and hardship
Find true love in an unexpected place
Redeem themselves from a major mistake or crime
Communicate and make peace with an alien species
Break free from a controlling or abusive relationship
Restore their honor after being falsely accused
Survive a journey through a perilous wilderness
Solve a complex and ancient mystery
Become a renowned artist, musician, or writer
Lead a revolution against an oppressive system
Protect a rare and endangered species
Overcome a debilitating fear or phobia
Navigate the complexities of court politics and intrigue
Find a way back home after being stranded far away
Learn the true meaning of friendship and loyalty
Make amends for past wrongdoings and find redemption
Break down social barriers and bring about change
Survive a brutal and unjust prison sentence
Confront and defeat a powerful and malevolent force
Become a leader and role model in their community
Forge a legendary weapon or artifact
Rise from obscurity and become a celebrated hero
Navigate a political conspiracy and come out unscathed
Prove their worth in a society that undervalues them
Reclaim their rightful throne or position
Survive and adapt in a rapidly changing world
Decode an ancient prophecy and prevent its ominous outcome
Build a new life in a foreign land
Heal from a traumatic experience and find strength
Balance the demands of power with personal morals
Uncover a hidden talent or ability within themselves
Bring together a divided community or family
Stop the neighbor from making noise
Win a bet no matter the cost
Secure a promotion by any means necessary
Hide a secret from a close friend
Manipulate a situation to their advantage
Get out of a tedious task
Keep a valuable find rather than returning it
Gain fame without working hard for it
Outsmart the law for personal gain
Infiltrate a group to learn their secrets
Convince someone to do their bidding
Get revenge for a minor slight
Gain control over a situation through deceit
Obtain a rare item, regardless of the means
Cut corners to finish a project
Lie to protect their own interests
Cheat in a game or contest
Evade taxes or other financial obligations
Use flattery to get what they want
Ignore rules that they find inconvenient
Feign illness to avoid an event
Exploit a loophole for personal gain
Take credit for someone elses work
Use someones weakness to their advantage
Blame others for their own mistakes
Pretend to be someone theyre not
Steal a friends idea and claim it as their own
Break a promise if it benefits them
Play both sides in a conflict
Use emotional manipulation to get their way
Prioritize their comfort over others needs
Take advantage of a friend's generosity
Bend the truth to make a story more interesting
Influence others to make a risky decision
Fake an interest to gain favor
Bargain aggressively to get a better deal

CHARACTER_SPEECH: High pitch - Voice sits in upper register; may convey youth, excitement, or tension
Low pitch - Voice sits in lower register; often perceived as authoritative or calm
Nasal - Voice resonates through the nose; can sound pinched or whiny
Resonant - Voice fills space with rich tones; projects well and sounds full
Raspy - Rough, grating quality; suggests smoking, illness, or natural huskiness
Smooth - Clean, clear delivery without roughness; pleasant to listen to
Breathy - Air escapes with words; can indicate intimacy, weakness, or sensuality
Strong - Firm, supported delivery; projects confidence and power
Loud - High volume speech; may indicate extroversion or desire for attention
Soft-spoken - Low volume speech; suggests shyness, intimacy, or restraint
Verbose - Uses many words; enjoys elaboration and detail
Concise - Uses minimal words; values efficiency in communication
Formal - Adheres to proper grammar and elevated vocabulary; maintains distance
Casual - Relaxed grammar and colloquial terms; creates familiarity
Eloquent - Articulate expression with graceful phrasing; demonstrates education
Simple vocabulary - Basic word choices; may indicate limited education or preference for clarity
Complete sentences - Fully formed thoughts; shows methodical thinking
Fragments - Incomplete sentences; suggests rapid thinking or emotional state
Circular - Talks around points before reaching them; avoids directness
Direct - Gets straight to the point; values efficiency and clarity
Uses catchphrases - Repeats signature phrases; creates recognizable speech pattern
Distinctive greetings - Unique ways of saying hello/goodbye; establishes character identity
Unique metaphors - Special comparisons reflecting background or worldview
Personal idioms - Self-created expressions; reveals thought patterns
Self-interruptions - Breaks own speech flow; indicates self-editing or racing thoughts
Trailing off - Leaves sentences unfinished; suggests distraction or reluctance
Frequent questions - Regular interrogatives; shows curiosity or conversational style
Rhetorical questions - Questions requiring no answer; demonstrates thinking aloud
Filler words - Uses "um," "like," "you know"; reveals nervousness or speech habits
Unusual word order - Arranges sentences distinctively; may indicate foreign background
Regional accent - Pronunciation specific to geographic area; grounds character in place
Dialect - Regional vocabulary and grammar; stronger than accent in establishing origin
Professional jargon - Field-specific terminology; reveals occupation
Terminology - Specialized vocabulary; indicates expertise or interest areas
Multilingual influences - Word choices from multiple languages; shows diverse background
Code-switching - Alternating between language styles; indicates adaptability
Period-specific language - Words from particular era; establishes time period or age
Class markers - Speech patterns indicating socioeconomic status; reveals upbringing
Educational indicators - Vocabulary level and grammar usage; suggests formal learning
Rural speech - Country-associated patterns; contrasts with urban speech
Expressive - Shows feelings openly through words; emotional transparency
Restrained - Controls emotional display in speech; maintains composure
Sarcastic - Uses irony to convey opposite meaning; creates distance through humor
Earnest - Speaks with sincerity; shows genuine feelings without irony
Dry humor - Subtle, deadpan comedy; intelligence indicator
Obvious humor - Clear jokes and punchlines; seeks immediate response
Emotionally transparent - Feelings evident in speech; nothing hidden
Guarded - Careful about revealing feelings; protects vulnerability
Optimistic framing - Presents situations positively; sees opportunity
Pessimistic framing - Emphasizes negatives; anticipates problems
Interrupts - Cuts others off; indicates eagerness or disrespect
Patient waiting - Allows others to finish; shows respect or strategic listening
Frequent topic changes - Shifts conversation suddenly; suggests scattered thinking
Focus on one topic - Maintains conversational direction; indicates concentration
Storytelling - Communicates through narratives; values context and color
Factual reporting - Sticks to information; values accuracy over engagement
Direct communication - States meanings clearly; avoids ambiguity
Evasiveness - Avoids clear answers; suggests secrets or discomfort
Question-asking - Interrogative approach; shows curiosity or control
Statement-making - Declarative approach; demonstrates confidence in opinions
PRIMARY_TRAUMATIC_EVENT: Sudden death of a parent or guardian
Major medical emergency as a child
Chronic illness diagnosis that changed life trajectory
Got lost for hours or days as a child
Severe childhood bullying that lasted years
Long-term hospitalization of a family member
Wrongly accused of a serious act
Major cultural displacement or immigration trauma
Living through a natural disaster (hurricane, earthquake, wildfire)
Neighborhood shooting or sudden community violence
Traumatizing encounter with an animal (attack, mauling, bite)
Sudden disappearance of a friend or family member
Accidental harm caused by the character (perceived or real)
Identity theft that spiraled out of control
Addiction in adolescence that caused lasting damage
Attempted suicide or ideation at a young age
Sudden betrayal by someone deeply trusted
Public cancellation or mass online harassment
Catfished in a deeply emotional relationship
Got scammed out of life savings
Crypto rug-pull that destroyed their finances
Lost digital art, writing, or years of work in a corrupted drive
Accidentally caused public outrage with a post
Severe performance anxiety after a catastrophic failure
Carrying guilt from something they said before someone's death
Developed phobia due to isolated incident
Fell into cult-like community and escaped
Forced to grow up too quickly due to absent parents
Lost a role or opportunity that defined their identity
Best friend suddenly cut them out with no explanation
Romantic partner abruptly disappeared (ghosting before phones)
Carried responsibility for younger siblings at a young age
Raised in extremely strict household with no freedom
Encounter with a demon, spirit, or malevolent entity
Lost family to a magical plague
Mentor or mage figure betrayed them
Banished from their clan or kingdom
Saw a prophecy involving their death
Failed to save someone during a magical disaster
Magical ability once hurt someone they love
Cybernetic implant that caused pain or malfunctions
Genetic modification that didn’t go as intended
Watched a city fall to drones or autonomous weapons
Time loop trauma (remembering loops others forget)
Forced to flee as a refugee
Protected others under fire and failed
Government regime change causing family collapse
Committed an act in war that haunts them
Saw something impossible and never got closure
Object or artifact that followed them
Were the only survivor of a supernatural incident
Experienced recurring night terrors from unknown source
Disappeared for hours/days with no memory
Heard voices in a place they shouldn’t exist
Faced an entity that marked them
Lost a loved one to an unexplained phenomenon
Partner cheated in a devastating public way
Familial rejection for identity or beliefs
Mentor turned out to be corrupt
Catastrophic failure at a defining moment
Dream project collapsed due to someone else’s actions
SECONDARY_TRAUMATIC_EVENT: Public embarrassment that became a school legend
Romantic partner ended things without explanation
Lost a treasured item with emotional history
Failed an important exam and spiraled
Harsh rejection in a creative pursuit
Phone stolen with years of memories
Ghosted in a long-term digital relationship
Identity mistaken online leading to harassment
Blackout or outage in dangerous moment
Long-term burnout from job or school
Lost digital work, manuscript, or game save
Major holiday meltdown or family disaster
Parents prioritized a sibling over them
Strained sibling relationship that never healed
Not chosen for a team or role they trained hard for
Lost childhood best friend to moving away
Failed at an early magical test
Magical accident left a small scar or mark
Saw a creature no one believes exists
Had to abandon a home colony
Virtual reality incident that felt too real
Saw someone glitch due to unstable augmentation
Brief shadow encounter they can’t explain
Object that moved when they blinked
Family story that turned out to be true
Night spent in a haunted place on a dare
Saw someone possessed (or thought they did)
Unresolved conflict with someone they loved
Someone they admired dismissed them harshly
Sudden job loss that changed their path
Led a project that failed publicly
Coworker stole credit for something big
Accidentally killed a family pet’s friend (e.g., fish, hamster)
Got trapped in elevator or small space
Local crime spree targeted their neighborhood

tarot_cards.name: The Fool
tarot_cards.upright: New beginnings, innocence, leap of faith, free spirit
tarot_cards.reversed: Reckless choices, hesitation, fear of change, poor judgment

tarot_cards.name: The Magician
tarot_cards.upright: Manifestation, skill, willpower, mastery of tools

tarot_cards.name: The High Priestess
tarot_cards.upright: Intuition, secrets, inner knowledge, hidden truths

tarot_cards.name: The Emperor
tarot_cards.reversed: Domineering behavior, rigidity, abuse of power

tarot_cards.name: The Chariot
tarot_cards.reversed: Lack of direction, scattered energy, giving up

tarot_cards.name: Justice
tarot_cards.upright: Truth, fairness, cause and effect, consequences
tarot_cards.reversed: Injustice, lies, unfair treatment, karma imbalance

tarot_cards.name: Death
tarot_cards.reversed: Fear of change, clinging to the past
